intro: Gonolobus parvifolius, commonly known as the small-leaf go-nola, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often resembling a globular shape. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some areas for its unique floral display.
